title: EVZ Academy
text:
EVZ Academy is a <a href="Switzerland">Swiss</a> professional <a href="ice%20hockey">ice hockey</a> team who play in <a href="Zug">Zug</a>, Switzerland. They have played since the <a href="2016-17%20National%20League%20B%20season">2016–17</a> season in the <a href="Swiss%20League">Swiss League</a> (SL), the second tier of the main professional ice hockey league in Switzerland, behind the <a href="National%20League%20%28ice%20hockey%29">National League</a>, as the primary affiliate to <a href="EV%20Zug">EV Zug</a>.
History.
The club name is derived from Zug's junior program "The Hockey Academy" and was founded with the purpose to serve as an affiliate club to shareholder and National League club, <a href="EV%20Zug">EV Zug</a>. They submitted an application to play in the <a href="National%20League%20B">National League B</a> and were permitted to play in the <a href="2016-17%20National%20League%20B%20season">2016–17</a> season.
EVZ Academy plays its home games in the Zug's training rink, Academy Arena, as well as occasionally in the <a href="Bossard%20Arena">Bossard Arena</a>, in Sursee, home to EV Zug. In their debut season, EVZ Academy collected just 10 wins in 48 games to finish in 10th place.
In the 2018–19 season, <a href="Jason%20O%27Leary">Jason O'Leary</a> replaced inaugural head coach <a href="Stefan%20Hedlund">Stefan Hedlund</a>, who was promoted to EV Zug's coaching staff. Having won the Swiss League in 2017 with <a href="SC%20Langenthal">SC Langenthal</a>, O'Leary led Academy to their second playoff berth, claiming 8th position before losing to regular season champions <a href="HC%20La%20Chaux-de-Fonds">HC La Chaux-de-Fonds</a>.
At the conclusion of the season, O'Leary left to coach top flight DEL club <a href="Iserlohn%20Roosters">Iserlohn Roosters</a>, and he was replaced by <a href="Roger%20Hansson%20%28ice%20hockey%29">Roger Hansson</a>, as Academy's third head coach.
